answers.answer: Hello everyone. This is my second pregnancy and my daughter was born pre term at 36 weeks. My doctor told me I should take the progesterone injections (makena) starting at 16 weeks. However; I've been doing some research and it shows that Makena increases your chance of miscarriage later in pregnancy and still birth. I'm so worried. Has anyone taken this or know anyone who has? I'm not sure what to do :(
^I don't think your doctor would suggest getting the shots if it wasn't ok.
I could go for a drink too. But instead I turn to Ben and Jerry's ice cream. Lol.
I've got gestational diabetes so I can't have the ice cream either... *sob*
I'm not craving anything and I cant even think of any comfort food that could help.Except alcohol lol
How I feel most days lol I even couldn't on my 21srt ): thank god its only temporary lol

Omg the crying is the worse!  I didn't drink even before being pregnant,  but I still have those days where it seems like nothing can go right. I'm a ftm and almost 16 weeks and holy crap! I had no idea how bad the hormones would be. Seems like everything makes me cry. Someone can look at me wrong or snap at me and I lose all self control and start sobbing. It is completely out of character for me.

Theres a leftover Heineken from my husband's company sitting on the shelf in the fridge. It looks so cold. Everytime I open the fridge I look at it & my mouth waters cause I know it would taste so good.........
I drink water and pretend its alcohol. Not the same but helps
Same here . I asked my partner to bring two cold one at the delivery room I can't deal. Lol just kidding .

question: Where you just need a drink! But cant because you're pregnant so instead you  just cry.*sigh*
title: One of those days
